info.title: Octopush API
info.description:
Octopush allows you to automate sending SMS with your applications, software and information systems.
Integrate SMS using our SMS HTTP API.
With Octopush you can send SMS messages to more than 196 countries that are directly connected to our infrastructure for the best price with our SMS gateway API.

post.description:
This sends a simple SMS.

    simple (1 contact)
    campaign (up to 500 contacts)

You must indicate your phone numbers in the “recipients” parameter, which is an array containing objects of type “contact”.

sender.description: Sender of the message (if the user allows it), 3-11 alphanumeric characters (a-zA-Z0-9).

send_at.description: When you want to send the sms campaign. Format: DateTime ISO8601 (for ex: “2018-10-03T07:42:39-07:00”)

simulation_mode.description: (optional) If this value is “true”, your request will be simulated, and you will receive a fake result. Only some minimal validations will be executed.

request_id.description: (optional) To avoid sending same request multiple times, setup an request ID. In case the duplication will be detected, a validation error will be returned. A request_id will expire after 24 hours.

auto_optimize_text.description: (optional) By transmitting this field with “false” value, your text will not be optimized by Octopush robot (your message could contain unicode characters, or useless spaces that could increase the number of needed SMS for each contact)

value.text: This is a premium SMS with stop mention. STOP at XXXXX

post.description:
This service allows you to create a SMS campaign on a contact list.

This is an asynchronous process. This allows you to give dispatch orders without suffering a timeout. 4 services allow you to operate this type of sending:

    Creating the campaign on a list of contacts.
    Getting the status of the campaign (calculating, ready to send, failed)
    Deleting a list campaign
    Validating sending a list campaign

list_name.description: Name of the list to be used for the campaign.

text.description: Message text (from 1 to 1224 characters non unicode).

sender.description: Sender of the message (if the user allows it), 3-11 alphanumeric characters (a-zA-Z0-9).

send_at.description: When you want to send the sms campaign. Format: DateTime ISO8601 (for ex: “2018-10-03T07:42:39-07:00”).

auto_optimize_text.description: (optional) By transmitting this field with “false” value, your text will not be optimized by Octopush robot (your message could contain unicode characters, or useless spaces that could increase the number of needed SMS for each contact).

value.text: This is a Premium SMS with STOP. STOP at 30101

get.summary: Status SMS in a campaign list
get.description: This service allows you to obtain the status of a text message campaign on a list.

parameters.name: ticket_number
parameters.description: This is the ticket_number transmitted by Octopush after the call to the creation function

post.description: This service allows you to confirm the sending of a campaign whose status is “ready_to_be_sent”.

ticket_number.description: This is the ticket_number transmitted by Octopush after the call to the creation function
This is the ticket_number transmitted by Octopush after the call to the creation function

get.description:
This web service allows you to retrieve your balance by SMS.
The result gives you your balance in Premium and LowCost.

parameters.name: with_details
parameters.description: (optional) Adds the details of all the packs in your portfolio.

parameters.name: country_code
parameters.description: (optional) Code of the country where you want to get your balance. You must also fill in the product_name.

parameters.name: product_name
parameters.description: (optional) Name of the product in which you want to get your balance (sms_low_cost, sms_premium, vocal_sms, hlr). You must also fill in the country_code.

parameters.name: country_codes
parameters.description: (optional) The list of countries for which you wish to obtain the number of credits per product.

alert_type.description: Type of SMS to decide the alert threshold.

alert_email_to.description: E-mail address to which to send alerts.

alert_phone_number_to.description: Mobile phone number to send alerts to.

sender_for_sms_premium.description: Default sender for your SMS campaigns. 3 to 11 alphanumeric characters.

sender_for_vocal_sms.description: Default sender for your voice campaigns. 3 to 11 numeric characters.

phone_number_for_test_sms.description: Default phone number presented when creating a campaign on your online interface.

callback_url_for_inbounds.description: URL where you would like to receive AR SMS callbacks.

callback_url_for_sms_deliveries.description: URL where you would like to receive unsubscribe requests (stops).

callback_url_for_blacklisted_numbers.description: URL where you would like to receive callbacks from AR SMS Vocal.

callback_url_for_vocal_sms_deliveries.description: URL where you would like to receive inbound SMS callbacks.

email_for_inbounds.description: Email address to which you would like incoming SMS messages to be forwarded.

get.description: Allows you to recover your default configuration for your SMS campaigns.

post.description:
This sends a Voice SMS in modes:

    simple (1 contact)
    campaign (up to 500 contacts)

You must indicate your phone numbers in the “recipients” parameter, which is an array containing objects of type “contact”.

text.description: Message text (from 1 to 1224 characters non unicode).

recipients.description: List of Contact objects array of objects:

sender.description: Sender of the message (if the user allows it), 3-11 alphanumeric characters (a-zA-Z0-9).

send_at.description: When you want to send the sms campaign. Format: DateTime ISO8601 (for ex: “2018-10-03T07:42:39-07:00”).

simulation_mode.description: (optional) If this value is “true”, your request will be simulated, and you will receive a fake result. Only some minimal validations will be executed.

request_id.description: (optional) To avoid sending same request multiple times, setup an request ID. In case the duplication will be detected, a validation error will be returned. A request_id will expire after 24 hours.

value.text: Here is a Voice SMS to listen to

post.summary: Sending Voice SMS to a list
post.description:
This service allows you to create a Voice SMS campaign on a contact list.

This is a asynchronous process. This allows you to give dispatch orders without suffering a timeout. 4 services allow you to operate this type of sending:

    Creation of the SMS Voice campaign on a list of contacts.
    Getting the status of the campaign (calculating, ready to send, failed)
    Deleting a Voice SMS campaign on list
    Validating the sending of a Voice SMS campaign on list

list_name.description: Name of the list to be used for the campaign.

text.description: Message text (from 1 to 1224 characters non unicode).

recipients.description: List of Contact objects array of objects:

sender.description: Sender of the message (if the user allows it), 3-11 alphanumeric characters (a-zA-Z0-9).

send_at.description: When you want to send the sms campaign. Format: DateTime ISO8601 (for ex: “2018-10-03T07:42:39-07:00”).

simulation_mode.description: (optional) If this value is “true”, your request will be simulated, and you will receive a fake result. Only some minimal validations will be executed.

request_id.description: (optional) To avoid sending same request multiple times, setup an request ID. In case the duplication will be detected, a validation error will be returned. A request_id will expire after 24 hours.

get.summary: Status Voice SMS on a list
get.description: This service allows you to obtain the status of a Voice SMS campaign on a list.

parameters.name: ticket_number
parameters.description: This is the ticket transmitted by Octopush after the calling the creation function

post.summary: Confirm Voice SMS on a list
post.description: This service allows you to confirm the sending of a voice campaign whose status is “ready_to_be_sent”

delete.summary: Cancel Voice SMS on a list
delete.description: Allows you to cancel a Voice SMS campaign sent to a list.

list_name.description: Name of the list to which the contact should be added.

post.description: This web service allows you to add a contact to a list.
Allows you to create a blank contact list.

list_name.description: Name of the list to be created.

delete.description: This web service allows you to delete one or more contacts from your account or from a particular list.

post.description: This web service allows you to empty a contact list. This service is synchronous.

list_name.description: Name of the list to be emptied.

delete.description: This web service allows you to remove a contact list. This service is synchronous.

list_name.description: Name of the list to be removed.

post.description: Allows you to check the validity of a telephone line.
